title: Your favorite off meta bot lane and why it theoretically works?
body:
{{champion:53}} {{champion:23}}  If you are against a squishy support and land a pull with blitz it is almost a guaranteed kill for Tryn.

{{champion:25}} {{champion:50}}  One of them lands a snare and they stick swain q and morg w on top of the enemy followed by the other snare and just watch them melt.

replies.body:
{{champion:133}}  and {{champion:50}} 

Swain drops root, quinn displaces target, game over
We need you to duo this lane with someone called "Beatrice Bot"
Yeah, then I could die happy!

{{champion:51}} {{champion:14}} is pretty busted right now. Super good poke and if someone steps on a trap, sion can Q or if Sion lands Q, cait can trap. The reduced armor from sion's E mixed with cait's high early damage makes this lane stupid strong. Being a tank, Sion can abuse CoC mastery and be extremely relevant mid and late game.

{{champion:19}} + {{champion:222}}  Back before Warwick's W CD was significantly increased. Before the CD increase, the ability only costed 25 mana and the ability would be back by the time the attack speed wore off. Never lost with this combo. The level 6 cheese was reeeeeeeeaaaaaal. This was also the time that Jinx was a long stronger too.

{{champion:89}} {{champion:80}} 

Not only did they have some great lore together (prior to the whole re-write on Mount Targon/Taric rework), but if you play it as a hard-aggro kill lane, it works really well against any squishy support level 1.  It's one of those nasty cheese tactics, where you both start stun, rush to lane and let the death bush begin.  You don't need ignite, though depending on how close to the bush the enemy team walks, one of you might have to flash to get the first stun.  But like any kill lane, if you don't get ahead fast, you can end up being relatively useless.  It's still just soooo fun to play though.

i faced pre reworked annie+leblanc bot lane.
do not need to explain why that worked.
all i know is i was seeing grey an rushing banshee veil.
I like When my buddy goes Morde support. I want to try going Quinn or Graves with it, but I never have the balls to break the meta entirely in ranked games.

{{champion:157}} {{champion:54}}  Easy level 6.

Malphite is able to take some harass early due to his passive, and Yasuo's kit allows him to trade easily by providing safety tools with his passive shield, dash, and windwall.

Besides, who doesn't tilt when they see such a staple wombo-combo? lol

ahri/ekko

you both throw q at the wave and it clears it.  ekko lands his stun or ahri lands her charm, an enemy dies.  ekkos ult lets him stay in lane longer as does ahris passive.

note, this worked alot better when mana pots were a thing

also viktor/swain and tf/tali are pretty disgusting.

i played {{champion:78}} support for the first time against a {{champion:103}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:107}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:236}} 

that was a fun game

{{champion:412}}  ADC and {{champion:53}} Support.  It'll make your hair fall out.

Thresh's Pimp Hand (E) makes him a passable carry.
With coordination, you can Blitz Hook and Lantern someone under tower from the middle of lane.
Good luck getting away from them if they get a hold of you.

{{champion:17}} {{champion:69}} 
Teemo's e and Old Cassie's Q was really strong kill lane.
